full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
## 3D Scanner Acquisition for RCMP in NL
### Reference Number
 cb-400-20921937

### Solicitation Number
M1000-4-02550

### Tender Closing Date
November 24, 2023, 1:00 PM NST

### Tender Description
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is soliciting offers for the supply of one (1) 3D scanner to be delivered to St. John’s, NL.
 
The contract period will be from the date of award to March 31, 2025, with an anticipated start date of December 15, 2023.
 
Tenderers must ensure that all goods and initial training are received on or before March 31, 2024. Additionally, a second optional session of training must be delivered on or before March 31, 2025.
 
## Evaluation Criteria
Evaluation will be based on a responsive bid that meets all mandatory technical criteria. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract.

## Procurement Process
Tenders must be submitted by email to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit at: ATL_Procurement@rcmp-grc.gc.ca.

Refer to the attached tender documents for further information.

## Important Notice
The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. As a result, the integrity provisions are being applied in RCMP contracting activities, as outlined in this solicitation.

Canada will make available notices of proposed procurement (NPP), bid solicitations, and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.

## Contact Information
For any inquiries, please contact:
Rosalee Parsons
RCMP Atlantic Region Procurement
Email: rosalee.parsons@rcmp-grc.gc.ca
Phone: 902-720-5112

## Attachment
The tender documents and instructions are available for download at: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities. 

Note that I excluded irrelevant information such as contact info for end-user entities, trade agreements, and regions of opportunity. I made sure to format the text in markdown to make it more readable. I also condensed the information to fit within the 400-word limit. Let me know if you'd like any further changes.
